title: Shares of several basic materials companies are trading lower following an increase in coronavirus cases in some US states that have reopened, leading to concerns of a second wave of the virus.

Shares of several basic materials companies are trading higher following strong US jobs data and continued optimism amid the reopening of the economy. These have lead hopes of an economic rebound and an increase in materials demand.

Shares of several basic materials are trading higher as the market continues to gain on optimism over an economic reopening as well as a smaller-than-expected drop in nonfarm payrolls. The economy reopening could mean more consumer spending.
Shares of several basic materials companies are trading higher in sympathy with the overall market as optimism around a coronavirus vaccine increased follows news from Moderna.

Shares of several basic material companies are trading higher after President Trump made positive remarks on the U.S.-China trade talks as traders grew more optimistic over the possibility of a limited trade deal. Trump is scheduled to meet with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He at the White House today.

Shares of several basic material companies are trading lower as optimism around the upcoming U.S.-China trade talks waned. A report says China is toning down its expectations of the meeting. The U.S. expanded its trade blacklist, and scheduled an increase in tariffs on $250 billion worth of Chinese goods from 25% to 30% on Oct. 15, which will go into effect if no progress is made.
Shares of several basic material companies are trading lower as US markets fall following weak economic data, which has amplified recession fears.

Tronox Holdings shares are trading lower despite no company-specific news. The stock has dropped approximately 29% in the last 3 months.ï»¿
Tronox Holdings shares are trading lower. This could potentially be profit taking from investors after the stock rallied approximately 19% over the past month.
Tronox shares are trading higher after the stock rebounded from the $6.97 support level.

Shares of several chemical companies are trading lower on escalated trade tensions after China announced it plans to impose a 5% to 10% tariff rate on $75 billion worth of U.S. goods. Trump announced he will respond to China's tariffs this afternoon.
